result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael G Burns was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500 [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Michael G Burns

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: on Petition for Early Discharge from Probation 973.09(3)(d)
on Petition for Early Discharge from Probation 973.09(3)(d)

11:37 a.m.  Defendant present in court with Atty Jeanne Zamzow.  Lisa Vanden Branden for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Zamzow - have received an offer that defendant will accept.  Atty Zamzow recites offer - defendant will plea to count 1 and count 2 will be dismissed and read-in, with free to argue.  ADA concurs.  Defendant concurs.

Court goes over plea questionnaire with the defendant.  Court goes over constitutional rights with the defendant - defendant waives these rights.  Court goes over the elements of each offense.  Court instructs defendant of the maximum penalty.  Court instructs defendant regarding deportation.

Defendant enters a plea of NO CONTEST.  Court finds the plea is made freely, voluntarily, intelligently and understandingly.  Court finds there is a factual basis to support the plea.  Court finds the defendant guilty to count 1 as charged.  Court orders count 2 be dismissed and read-in.  Court orders the judgment of conviction be entered here today.  ADA confirms compliance with victim witness rights.  Sentencing statement by ADA.  Sentencing argument by Atty Zamzow.  No statement by the defendant.

Court sentences the defendant to:

SWD, and places the defendant on probation for 12 months.

CONDITIONS:

-Court costs.
-No Contact with the victim.  Forms of no contact include: in person, in writing, by telephone, by e-mail, or by any other forms of electronic communication, or through a third party intending to circumvent the no contact provision.
-Defendant is to abide by all rules and recommendations of the supervising agent.
-Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample.
-Defendant can apply for early termination of probation upon completion of all terms and payment of all monies.

Court adjourned at 11:45 a.m.

10:15 a.m.  No appearance by the defendant.  Attorney Jeanne Zamzow present.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Zamzow - received an offer and discovery and requests a status hearing be scheduled.  Court sets for Status Hearing on January 19, 2016 at 11:00 a.m. 

Court adjourned at 10:16 a.m.

Per Deb at the Public Defender's office, counsel will be appointed.  Will inform the defendant that he does not need to appear.
43

No Contact with Badgerland Express.  Forms of no contact include: in person, in writing, by telephone, by e-mail, or by any other forms of electronic communication, or through a third party intending to circumvent the no contact provision.  Defendant is to complete processing with the Green Lake County Sheriff's Department.

No Contact with Badgerland Express.  Forms of no contact include: in person, in writing, by telephone, by e-mail, or by any other forms of electronic communication, or through a third party intending to circumvent the no contact provision.  Defendant is to complete processing with the Green Lake County Sheriff's Department.

8:39 a.m.  Defendant present in court without counsel.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant confirms receipt of the criminal complaint and waives reading.  Court instructs the defendant of the maximum penalty on each count.  Court finds probable cause.  Court instructs the defendant of his right to an attorney.  Defendant stands mute.  Court enters a plea of NOT GUILTY on behalf of the defendant.  DA makes bond recommendation.  Court sets bond at $500.00 signature bond and conditions of:  No Contact with Badgerland Express.  Forms of no contact include: in person, in writing, by telephone, by e-mail, or by any other forms of electronic communication, or through a third party intending to circumvent the no contact provision.  Defendant is to complete processing with the Green Lake County Sheriff's Department.  Court will set for Status Hearing on November 17, 2015 at 9:15 a.m..

Court adjourned at 8:40 a.m.
